I think there are far more incidents to do with players banning another's hover after a denied lane-swap, than specifically to do with dedicated supports maliciously banning other's hover (which I have never seen, maybe once or twice, but otherwise pretty much negligible).

I don't even know what happened but I could guess that the guy was probably autofilled support, in which they asked for a lane-swap. After the whatever lane they are trying to swap to refuses the swapping, the enraged and now trolling autofilled player bans the player's hover as an act of protest and revenge (even though it's clearly a wrong on their part, because they're not entitled to a swap nor is intentionally banning an ally's hover a good conduct itself). But idk.
I always ban leona, I just dont know how to deal with her.

The following reasons people have to ban hovered champions:
- You want to pick a champ that is currently beyond broken, but are last pick setting your chances of getting it over the enemy at aorun 0%
- You want to pick blind pick Vayne (some people even find that reportable). Some ban Teemo way for the same reasons.
- You want to play Yasuo.
- Some supports will ban Zed (for either they are bad or think their adc is worthless) before even looking at you pre-pick.
- You want a not that often picked champion and happens to be the go to ban of that player, in which cae they just did not noticed it.
